data.title: Slash Guest Appearances Discography
data.meta_description: Slash Paradise - This is a page about Slash official guest appearances on albums: his discography includes collaborations with many musicians and artists.
data.text:
Alice Cooper

The Decline Of Western Civilization Part II soundtrack (1988)

Slash on "Under My Wheels"

Notes: Axl Rose and Izzy Stradlin also play on this song. Bob Dylan

Under The Red Sky (1990)

Slash on "Wiggle Wiggle"

Notes: George Harrison, Elton John and Stevie Ray Vaughan also appear on this record. Iggy Pop

Brick By Brick (1990)

Slash on "Home", "Butt Town","Pussy Power" & "My Baby Wants To R&R" | music video

Notes: Duff McKagan also features on these four songs. Sam Kinison

Leader Of The Banned (1990)

Slash on "Highway To Hell"

Notes: first and only guest appearance with Sam Kinison for this AC/DC cover. Alice Cooper

Hey Stoopid (1991)

Slash on "Hey Stoopid"

Notes: Ozzy Osbourne and Joe Satriani also appear on this song. Lenny Kravitz

Mama Said (1991)

Slash on "Fields Of Joy" & "Always On The Run" | music video

Notes: Slash co-wrote "Always On The Run" with Lenny Kravitz. Michael Jackson

Dangerous (1992)

Slash on "Black Or White" & "Give In To Me" | music video

Notes: Slash also appears in the music video with Gilby Clarke and Teddy Andreadis. Motorhead

March Or Die (1992)

Slash on "You Better Run" & "Ain't No Nice Guy" | music video

Notes: Ozzy Osbourne sings on "Ain't No Nice Guy". Spinal Tap

Break Like The Wind (1992)

Slash on "Break Like The Wind"

Notes: Joe Satriani also perfoms on this song, Cher and Steve Lukather on the album. Duff McKagan

Believe In Me (1993)

Slash on "Believe In Me" & "Just Not There"

Notes: Jeff Beck, Lenny Kravitz and Sebastian Bach also feature on this album. Carole King

Colour Of Your Dreams (1993)

Slash on "Hold Out For Love"

Notes: first guest appearance with Carole King. Paul Rodgers

Muddy Water Blues: Tribute To Muddy Waters (1993)

Slash on "The Hunter"

Notes: David Gilmour, Buddy Guy, Brian May and Gary Moore also perfom on this record. Michael Monroe

Coneheads soundtrack (1993)

Slash on "Magic Carpet Ride"

Notes: Steppenwolf cover recorded with Michael Monroe for Coneheads soundtrack. Brian May

Resurrection (1993)

Slash on "Tie Your Mother Down" | live video

Notes: performance recorded live at the Tonight with Jay Leno TV Show in May 1993. Paul Rodgers

Stone Free: Tribute To Jimi Hendrix (1993)

Slash on "I Don't Live Today"

Notes: Eric Clapton, Buddy Guy, Jeff Beck and The Cure also feature on this album. Carole King

In Concert (1994)

Slash on "Hold Out For Love" & "Locomotion" | live video

Notes: performance recorded in Hartford during a Carole King concert in September 1993. Gilby Clarke

Pawnshop Guitars (1994)

Slash on "Cure Me...Or Kill Me..." & "Tijuana Jail" | music video

Notes: Frank Black, Duff McKagan, Matt Sorum and Axl Rose also appear on this record. Paul Rodgers

Woodstock 94 (1994)

Slash on "The Hunter" | live video

Notes: Jimi Hendrix cover recorded live with Paul Rodgers and Jason Bonham. Eazy-E

Beverly Hills Cop 3 soundtrack (1994)

Slash on "Luv 4 Dem Gangsta'z"

Notes: even if he is not credited anywhere, Slash plays on this rap song with Eazy-E. Choir Of Harlem

Panther soundtrack (1995)

Slash on "The Star Spangled Banner"

Notes: Slash performs American anthem with Choir Of Harlem for this soundtrack. Carmine Appice

Guitar Zeus (1995)

Slash on "Where You Belong"

Notes: Brian May, Ted Nugent and Jennifer Batten also perform on this record. Michael Jackson

History Past Present And Future (1995)

Slash on "Black Or White" & "D.S."

Notes: second collaboration with Michael Jackson. Marta Sanchez

Curdled soundtrack (1996)

Slash on "Obsession Confession" & "Obsession"

Notes: an acoustic instrumental tune and electric version with Marta Sanchez. The Outpatience

Anxious Disease (1996)

Slash on "Anxious Disease"

Notes: West Arkeen also guests Axl Rose, Izzy Stardlin and Duff McKagan on this album. Boz Scaggs

The Concert For The Rock & Roll Hall of Fame (1996)

Slash on "Red House" | live video

Notes: Jimi Hendrix cover with Boz Scaggs recorded live in New York, September 1996. Teddy Andreadis

Innocent Loser (1996)

Slash on "Innocent Loser" & "Shotgun Shack"

Notes: Duff McKagan, Steve Lukather and Carole King also appear on this record. Marta Sanchez

Azabache (1997)

Slash on "Moja Mi Corazon" | music video

Notes: second guest appearance with Marta Sanchez. Sammy Hagar

Marching To Mars (1997)

Slash on "Little White Lie"

Notes: Matt Sorum also plays on one song from this album. Insane Clown Posse

The Great Milenko (1997)

Slash on "Halls Of Illusions"

Notes: ICP rappers also guest Alice Cooper and Steve Jones on this record. Alice Cooper

A Fistful Of Alice (1997)

Slash on "Lost In America", "Only Women Bleed" & "Elected" | live video

Notes: recorded live in Mexico in 1996 with Rob Zombie featuring on "Elected". Michael Jackson

Blood On The Dance Floor (1997)

Slash on "Morphine"

Notes: third collaboration with Michael Jakson. Sebastian Bach

Stairway To Heaven: Tribute To Led Zeppelin (1997)

Slash on "Communication Breakdown"

Notes: Zakk Wylde, Vivian Cambell and Lita Ford also contribute to this album. Blackstreet

Fix (1997)

Slash on "Fix (main mix)" | music video

Notes: Slash also makes guest appearance in the music video. J

Pyromania (1997)

Slash on "But You Said I'm Useless"

Notes: Slash plays three solos on this tune by this Japonese musician. Ella

El (1998)

Slash on "Bayangan"

Notes: an album only released in Malaysia. Graham Bonnet

The Day I Went Mad (1999)

Slash on "Oh! Darling"

Notes: Teddy Andreadis also features on this cover from The Beatles. Chic

Live At The Budokan (1999)

Slash on "Le Freak" & "Stone Free" | live video

Notes: recorded live with Chic and Nile Rodgers in Tokyo in April 1996. Roder Daltrey

Humanary Stew: Tribute To Alice Cooper (1999)

Slash on "No More Mr. Nice Guy"

Notes: Mike Inez, Bob Kulick and Carmine Appice also play on this song. Duff McKagan

Beautiful Disease (1999)

Slash on "Hope" & "Mezz"

Notes: Izzy Stradlin also perfoms on one song from this album. Doro Pesch

Calling The Wild (2000)

Slash on "Now Or Never"

Notes: Lemmy Kilmister, Al Pitrelli, Bob Kulick and Eric Singer also feature on this album. Rod Stewart

Human (2001)

Slash on "Human" & "Peach"

Notes: "Peach", a Prince cover, only available on "I Can't Deny It" single. Cheap Trick

Silver (2001)

Slash on "You're All Talk" | live video

Notes: recorded live in Rockford in August 1999. Slash

The Kid Stays In The Picture soundtrack (2002)

Slash on "Love Theme From The Godfather"

Notes: this song appears as a bonus track. Ray Charles

Sings For America (2002)

Slash on "God Bless America Again"

Notes: a tribute album to September 11th terrorist attacks victims. The Yardbirds

Birdland (2003)

Slash on "Over Under Sideways Down"

Notes: Joe Satriani, Steve Vai, Jeff Beck and Brian May also perform on this album. Elan

Street Child (2003)

Slash on "Street Child" | music video

Notes: Slash also makes guest appearance in the music video. Steve Lukather

Santamental (2003)

Slash on "Broken Heart For Christmas"

Notes: a Christmas songs cover album also featuring Eddie Van Halen and Steve Vai. Matt Sorum

Hollywood Zen (2003)

Slash on "The Blame Game"

Notes: first Matt Sorum solo album. Slash

Sing A Song With Six Strings (2004)

Slash on "Sing A Song Of Sixpence"

Notes: Slash is credited as the composer of this song. All Star Band

Across The Universe (2005)

Slash on "Across The Universe" | live video

Notes: iTunes single recorded live at Grammy Awards with Bono, Stevie Wonder and more. All Star Band

Save The Children (2005)

Slash on "Tears In Heaven" | music video

Notes: Elton John, Robbie Williams, Steven Tyler and more sing on this song. Ray Charles

More Music From Ray (2005)

Slash on "Baby Let Me Hold Your Hand"

Notes: Cat Stevens and Elton John also feature on this album. Brian Tyler

Fast And Furious 3 soundtrack (2006)

Slash on "Mustang Nismo", "Welcome To Tokyo" & "Sumo"

Notes: original soundtrack from the movie Fast And Furious Tokyo Drift. Derek Sherinian

Blood Of The Snake (2006)

Slash on "In The Summertime" | music video

Notes: Billy Idol sings on this song. Chris Daughtry

Daughtry (2006)

Slash on "What I Want"

Notes: Chris Daughtry is the winner of the American Idol TV show. Sarah Kelly

Where The Past Meets Today (2006)

Slash on "Still Breathing" & "Out Of Reach"

Notes: Jeff Beck, Dave Amato and Chris Chaney also feature on this album. Paulina Rubio

Ananda (2006)

Slash on "Nada Puede Cambiarme" | music video

Notes: this record reachs charts first place in many Latin American countries. Tommy Shaw

Gypsy (2007)

Slash on "Gypsy"

Notes: just a single without any album. Gina Gershon

In Search Of Cleo (2007)

Slash on "Lost At Sea"

Notes: a guest appearance on first album from the actress Gina Gershon. Liel Kolet

Be Free (2007)

Slash on "For The Love Of God"

Notes: Patti LaBelle also plays on this song. Slash

Guitar Hero 3 Legends Of Rock soundtrack (2007)

Slash on "Guitar Hero 3 Intro" & "Guitar Battle Vs. Slash"

Notes: Slash recorded these two instrumental tracks for Guitar Hero 3 video game. Vasco Rossi

Il Mondo Che Vorrei (2008)

Slash on "Gioca Con Me" | music video

Notes: this song is the first single of this record. Alice Cooper

Along Came A Spider (2008)

Slash on "Vengeance Is Mine" | music video

Notes: Ozzy Osbourne and Keri Kelli also make guest appearance on this album. Les Paul & Friends

A Tribute To A Legend: Tribute To Les Paul (2008)

Slash on "Vocalise"

Notes: Peter Frampton, Joe Perry and Richie Sambora also feature on this album. Edgar Winter

Rebel Road (2008)

Slash on "Rebel Road"

Notes: Johnny Winter and Clint Black also add their contribution to this record. Stephen Wesley

The Road (2009)

Slash on "Cowgirl"

Notes: Steve Salas and BC Jean also perform on this record. Williams Riley Band

Williams Riley Band (2009)

Slash on "Road & Me"

Notes: a guest featuring on first album from this country band. Clint Mansell

The Wrestler soundtrack (2009)

Slash on "The Wrestler"

Notes: Slash collaborates with Clint Mansell on movie main theme. Escala

Escala (2009)

Slash on "Kashmir"

Notes: a Led Zeppelin cover song. Jerry Lee Lewis

Mean Old Man (2009)

Slash on "Rockin' My Life Away"

Notes: Kid Rock sings on this song. Bruno

Bruno soundtrack (2009)

Slash on "Dove Of Peace" | music video

Notes: Bono, Sting, Snoop Dog, Elton John and Chris Martin also feature on this song. Rihanna

Rated R (2009)

Slash on "Rockstar 101"

Notes: Young Jeezy and Will.i.am also feature on this record. The Dirty Heads

Any Port In A Storm (2010)

Slash on "Check The Level"

Notes: supposed to appear on special edition, this song was only published online. Matt Sorum & Lanny Cordola

Global Sound Lodge (2010)

Slash on "Hands Together"

Notes: a tribute song to earthquake victims in Haiti. The Who

My Generation (remix) (2010)

Slash on "My Generation"

Notes: Will.i.am recruites Slash to help rework this classic track. Slash

Triple M radio (2010)

Slash on "Dr. Dan Theme" | music video

Notes: Slash recorded this instrumental track for Triple M radio. Macy Gray

The Sellout (2010)

Slash on "Kissed It"

Notes: Duff McKagan and Matt Sorum also play on this track. Lee Ritenour

Six String Theory (2010)

Slash on "68"

Notes: Steve Lukather and Neal Schon also perfom on this song. Ronnie Wood

I Feel Like Playing (2010)

Slash on "Thing Like", "Sweetness My Weakness", "Spoonful", "Fancy Pants" & "Forever"

Notes: Eddie Vedder, Flea, Billy Gibbons and Ian McLagan also contribute to this album. Beth Hart

My California (2010)

Slash on "Sister Heroine"

Notes: second collaboration with Beth Hart in 2010. The Forest Rangers & Battleme

Sons Of Anarchy soundtrack (2010)

Slash on "Miles Away"

Notes: a song that features on television series Sons Of Anarchy. State Line Empire

Octane (2011)

Slash on "Drive Me"

Notes: this band is the winner of Your Next Record with Slash contest. Travis Barker

Give The Drummer Some (2011)

Slash on "Saturday Night" | music video

Notes: Corey Taylor, Cypress Hill, Snoop Dogg and Tom Morello participate to this record. Phineas & Ferb

Across The 1st and 2nd Dimensions soundtrack (2011)

Slash on "Kick It Up A Notch" | music video

Notes: a song recorded for Walt Disney television series Phineas & Ferb. Leslie West

Unusual Suspects (2011)

Slash on "Mudflap Mama" & "Turn Out The Lights"

Notes: Zakk Wylde also plays guitar on "Turn Out The Lights". Samantha Ronson & The Undertakers

Chasing The Reds (2011)

Slash on "Love Song"

Notes: Wale and Alex Greenwald also perform on this album. Slash & Mark Lanegan

This Is Not A Movie soundtrack (2011)

Slash on "So Long Sin City"

Notes: song published on Slash official website in 2012. Slash & Witch

The Hex Is On... And Then Some (2011)

Slash on "Playing In The Rain"

Notes: song originally recorded in 1997 for a side project of one of the band members. B.B. King

Live At The Royal Albert Hall (2012)

Slash on "Jam", "The Thrill Is Gone", "Guess Who" & "When The Saints Go" | live video

Notes: recorded live in London in 2011 and also featuring Ronnie Wood on guitar. Lou Pallo

Thank You Les: Tribute To Les Paul (2012)

Slash on "Deep In The Blues"

Notes: Keith Richards, Billy Gibbons and Steve Miller also contribute to this record. Adler

Back From The Dead (2012)

Slash on "Just Don't Ask"

Notes: Johnny 5 also plays guitar on one song. Chuckie & Betatraxx

Rocktronica (2013)

Slash on "Rocktronica"

Notes: Slash recorded that song on a computer with Amplitube in a hotel room. Slash

Angry Birds Space soundtrack (2013)

Slash on "Angry Birds Space Theme" | music video

Notes: Slash recorded this instrumental track for Angry Birds Space video game. The Dead Daisies

The Dead Daisies (2013)

Slash on "Lock 'N' Load"

Notes: Slash co-wrote "Lock 'N' Load" with Jon Stevens. Halestorm

The Strange Case Of... (2013)

Slash on "Here's To Us" (guest version) | music video

Notes: this song, featuring Myles Kennedy, appears on album deluxe edition. Artful Badger

Badger Swagger (2013)

Slash on "Badger Swagger"

Notes: Brian May, Shara Nelson, Sam Ritchie and Sonny Green also perfom on this song. Slash & Nicholas O'Toole

Nothing Left To Fear soundtrack (2013)

Slash on "Nothing Left To Fear" & "Welcome To Stull"

Notes: Slash co-wrote the album and plays short guitar harmonies on some other tracks. Type II

Don't Give Up (2013)

Slash on "Crimson Chaos" & "Here We Go"

Notes: available online, Slash recorded this for Road Recovery non-profit organization. Aaron Freeman

Bob Dylan In The 80s: Tribute To Bob Dylan (2014)

Slash on "Wiggle Wiggle"

Notes: Slash recorded the original song with Bob Dylan in 1990. Printz Board

Board Games (2014)

Slash on "Rockstar Moments"

Notes: Slash plays lead guitar on this song by famous producer Printz Board. Bernard Fowler

The Bura (2015)

Slash on "My Friend Sin", "Second Place" & "Dragon Attack" | music video

Notes: three songs recorded back in 2013. Slash

Universal Monsters Maze soundtrack (2018)

Slash on "We Belong Dead", "Danse Of The Dead", "Final Scare", "Universal Monsters Rising", "Collection Room-Dracula's Lair", "Monsters, Maniacs, Madmen" & "Sweet Licks" Don Felder

American Rock 'N' Roll (2019)

Slash on "American Rock 'N' Roll"

Notes: Mike Fleetwood and Chad Smith also play on this song from Eagles guitarist. Les Stroud

Mother Earth (2019)

Slash on "One Giant Farm"

Notes: Steve Vai and Mindi Abair also appear on this album by Canadian filmmaker. Ghost Hounds

Roses Are Black (2019)

Slash on "Black Rose" and "We Roll Hard"

Notes: Kenny Aronoff, Reese Wynans and Michael Rhodes also appears on this album. Ozzy Osbourne

Ordinary Man (2020)

Slash on "Straight To Hell" & "Ordinary Man"

Notes: Elton John, Duff McKagan, Chad Smith and Andrew Watt also play with Slash. Cherie Currie

Blvds Of Splendor (2020)

Slash on "Mr. X"

Notes: Duff McKagan and Matt Sorum also perfom on this song. Sixx AM

Sno Babies soundtrack (2020)

Slash on "Maybe It's Time"

Notes: Corey Taylor and Joe Elliott also play on this track. Slash

Love Story (2020)

Slash on "Where Do I Begin?"

Notes: available online, Slash recorded this song in honor of film producer Robert Evans. Tom Morello

Comandante (2020)

Slash on "Interstate 80" | music video

Notes: Slash first studio collaboration with his friend Tom Morello. Black Pumas

Peace Through Music (2021)

Slash on "Colors" | music video

Notes: a song for A Global Event for the Environment only available online. Marc LaBelle

Legacy: Tribute To Leslie West (2022)

Slash on "Mississippi Queen"

Notes: a cover of Mountain song with Marc LaBelle. Michael Monroe

I Live Too Fast To Die Young (2022)

Slash on "I Live Too Fast To Die Young" | music video

Notes: this is the fourth studio song Slash recorded with Michael Monroe in 30 years. Kings Of Chaos

Judgement Day (2022)

Slash on "Judgement Day"

Notes: this single reunite Matt Sorum, Dave Kushner, Duff McKagan and Slash. Ian Hunter

Defiance Part 1 (2023)

Slash on "Defiance"

Notes: Slash appears on title track with Robert Trujillo on bass. Chris Janson

The Outlaw Side Of Me (2023)

Slash on "21 Forever"

Notes: Dolly Parton also appears on this song with Slash. Ryan Gosling

Barbie soundtrack (2023)

Slash on "I'm Just Ken"

Notes: Slash teams up with Ryan Gosling and Wolfgang Van Halen for this track. Demi Lovato

Revamped (2023)

Slash on "Sorry Not Sorry"

Notes: a rock version of the original song from 2017. Duff McKagan

Lighthouse (2023)

Slash on "Hope"

Notes: this is a reworked version of the song from 1993 abum Beautiful Disease. Fear

Nice Boys (2023)

Slash on "Nice Boys"

Notes: Duff McKagan also plays on this track. The Dandy Warhols

Rockmaker (2024)

Slash on "I'd Like To Help You With Your Problem"

Notes: Black Francis from The Pixies also appears on the record. Mark Knopfler

Going Home (2024)

Slash on "Going Home"

Notes: this song brings together more than 60 musicians on a single track including Slash. Bear McCreary

The Singularity (2024)

Slash on "Escape From The Machines" and "The End Of Tomorrow"

Notes: Joe Satriani plays with Slash on one of these two tracks of this concept album. Michael Schenker

My Years With UFO (2024)

Slash on "Mother Mary"

Notes: Axl Rose also sings a song on this album.
